Later Venus atmosphere is fully prepared. Some problems with missing magnetic field will be solved.Some hundreds years later Venus is prepared for colonization.

First you would cease to be alive, and then you would cease to exist. Venus' has an atmosphere that rains sulfuric acid and if you held a block of lead in your hand, you could feel it flow through your fingers. Not much can survive on the surface. HOWEVER, there is still hope! 50 km above the surface, conditions are surprisingly Earth-like. The atmosphere is still toxic, and there's still acid, but temperature and pressure are very similar to Earth. Furthermore, due to the high molar mass of the atmosphere, normal (breathable) air floats, allowing large cloud cities to be made easily. TL;DR: The surface is a no-go, and the upper atmosphere is filled with acid, but aerial habitats are surprisingly livable.
